page.title: 12SCHOOLS IN WOODSTOCK
page.content: There are two schools in Woodstock, a primary and a secondary school. The Marlborough School is a mixed ability 11-18 school. It was built in 1939. There are 45 teachers at the school and about 800 pupils including some handicapped children. The school has pioneered many new ideas. In the afternoons pupils choose activities from a list including gardening, beekeeping and sailing. The History Club and Class 1S collected and wrote the material in this survey. The Primary School was built in 1854 and a new building was built a quarter of a mile away in 1967. They decided to clse down the Old School recently because will be much easier with everybody together. The extension to the New School will be finished by Christmas. There are 250 children in the school where there were once 450.
